content:
Patel, Rahul Metchev, Stanimir Heinze, Aren Finding Warm Debris Disks with WISE Around Bright Stars 212 <p>We present a sensitive search for <em>WISE</em> <em>W</em>3 (12 μm) and <em>W</em>4 (22 μm) excesses from warm optically thin dust around <em>Hipparcos</em> main sequence stars within 75 pc from the Sun. We use contemporaneously measured photometry from <em>WISE</em>, remove sources of contamination, and derive and apply corrections to saturated fluxes to attain optimal sensitivity to >10 μm excesses. We use data from the <em>WISE</em> All-Sky Survey Catalog rather than the AllWISE release because we find that its saturated photometry is better behaved, allowing us to detect small excesses even around saturated stars in <em>WISE</em>. Our new discoveries increase by 45% the number of stars with warm dusty excesses and expand the number of known debris disks (with excess at any wavelength) within 75 pc by 29%. We identify 220 <em>Hipparcos</em> debris disk host stars, 108 of which are new detections at any wavelength. We present the first measurement of a 12 μm and/or 22 μm excess for 10 stars with previously known cold (50-100 K) disks. We also find five new stars with small but significant <em>W</em>3 excesses, adding to the small population of known exozodi, and we detect evidence for a <em>W</em>2 excess around HIP 96562 (F2V), indicative of tenuous hot (780 K) dust. As a result of our <em>WISE</em> study, the number of debris disks with known 10-30 μm excesses within 75 pc (379) has now surpassed the number of disks with known >30 μm excesses (289, with 171 in common), even if the latter have been found to have a higher occurrence rate in unbiased samples.</p> debris disks; WISE; planetary systems; protoplanetary disks; zodiacal dust; statistics; 2014-06-18
    http://zenodo.org/record/10592/files/RahulPatel_CS18_WISE.png; http://zenodo.org/record/10592/files/RahulPatel_CS18_WISE.png?subformat=icon-90;
